newsitem.title: GERMANY: Degussa mulls separating its metals unit.
newsitem.headline: Degussa mulls separating its metals unit.

text.p: German chemicals and metals group Degussa AG said on Wednesday it was considering separating its precious metals unit into a separate company in October.
"Such steps are currently being investigated and will be presented to the board of directors to be decided on September," Degussa said in a statement.
Degussa stressed that it was not considering selling the unit outright. "A sale is not being considered."
The rationale behind such a step would be to improve the unit's earning potential and consequently lift the entire group's competitiveness, Degussa said.
A company spokeman declined to comment further on the matter saying the statement was made merely to counter market talk.

Several German companies, including most notably chemicals and drug giant Hoechst AG, are currently turning some of their units into separate legal entities as part of a bid to improve share holder value. The Degussa spokesman however said the company was not planning to list the precious metals unit on the bourse.
Degussa's shares closed afterhours IBIS trading up 3.50 marks at 95 marks.
